str.o: Show some information about how pike is using the memory it has allocated. Mostly useful for developers.
str.t: Visar en del information om hur Pike använder det minne som allokerats. Mest användbart för utvecklare.

str.o: Show information about which features and modules are available in the Pike this Roxen is using.
str.t: Visa information om vilka moduler och finesser som är tillgängliga i den Pike som Roxen använder.

str.o: All memory caches have been flushed.

str.t: Visar information om alla tillgängliga typsnitt och exempel på deras användning.

str.o: Jackdaws love my big sphinx of quartz.
str.t: Gud hjälpe W. Zorns mö qvickt få byxa.

str.o: Shows various information about the module thread locks in Roxen.
str.t: Visar en del information om de moduler som behöver låsning vid användning av trådar i Roxen.

str.o: Module lock status : Accesses to all modules
Locked means that the access was done using a serializing lock since the module was not thread-safe, unlocked means that there was no need for a lock.
str.t: 'Låst' innebär att anropen gjordes via en seriell låsning eftersom modulen inte var trådsäker; 'Ej låst' innebär att det inte fanns behov av låsning.

str.o: Locked accesses to a single module can inflict quite a severe performance degradation of the whole server, since a locked module will act as a bottleneck, blocking access for all other threads that want to access that module.
str.t: Låsta anrop till en enda modul kan innebära försämrad prestanda för hela servern, eftersom den modulen blir en flaskhals som tvingar andra trådar i behov av denna modul att vänta.

str.o: Show a list of all open files and network connections.
str.t: Visa en lista över alla öppna filer och nätverksanslutningar.

str.o: Force a reload of all configuration information from the configuration files.
str.t: Gör så att alla inställningar läses om från konfigurationsfilerna.

str.o: Check which modules handles the path you enter in the form
str.t: Kontrollera vilka moduler som hanterar en viss URL

str.o: There is no configuration available that matches this URL.
str.t: Det finns ingen sajt som hanterar en sådan URL.

str.o: You might see the old process for a while in the process table when doing 'ps' or running 'top'. This is normal. Roxen waits for a while for all connections to finish, the process will go away after at most 15 minutes.
str.t: Det är möjligt att den gamla processen ligger kvar ett tag. Detta är normalt. Roxen väntar ett tag på att alla anslutningar ska avslutas, processen försvinner efter senast 15 minuter.

str.o: Shows a backtrace (stack) for each and every thread in Roxen.
This is only a problem if a significant percentage of the accesses are passed through non-threadsafe modules.
str.t: Det är bara ett problem om en signifikant del av serverns anrop passerar genom icke tråd-säkra moduler.

str.o: These are all active virtual servers. They are sorted by the number of requests they have received - the most active being first. Servers which haven't recieved any requests are not listed.
str.t: Detta är alla aktiva virtuella servrar som har fått något anrop. De är sorterade enligt flest anrop högst upp.

str.o: Shows the amount of data handled since last restart.
str.t: Visar mängd hanterad data sedan servern startade senast.

str.o: List all active FTP sessions and what files they are currently transferring.
str.t: Visa alla aktiva FTP-sessioner och vilka filer som överförs.

str.o: There are currently no active FTP sessions.
Show information about the main memory cache in Roxen
Shows detailed process status on Solaris 2.5 and later.
str.t: Visar detaljerad processinformaiton på Solaris 2.5 och senare.

str.o: Shows various information about the Roxen process.
In order to use the SSL on your server, you first have to create a random RSA key pair. One part of the key is kept secret.
The other part should be submitted to a certificate authority, such as Thawte or VeriSign. The certificate authority will return the signed certificate that need to run a secure server.

The other part is used to create a certificate. You can create a certificate yourself; this is not the recommended way to use SSL, and browsers will complain about not recognizing the entity that has signed the key (i.e. you). But a self-signed certificate is a lot better than nothing.
Keys smaller than %d bits are ridiculous.
Keys larger than %d bits would take too long to generate.
How large key do you want to generate?
The desired key size. This is a security parameter; larger keys gives better security, but it also makes connecting to the server a little slower.

The largest RSA key that is publicly known to have been broken was 155 decimal digits, or 512 bits large. This effort required approximately 8000 MIPS-years.

A key 1024 bits large should be secure enough for most applications, but of course you can you use an even larger key if you so wish.
Where to store the file, may be relative to %s.
str.t: Var filen ska sparas, kan vara relatvit till %s i filsystemet.

str.o: A filename in the real filesystem, where the secret key should be stored. This is the filename you enter in the 'Key file'-field when you configure an SSL listen port.

Your X.501 Distinguished Name consists of a chain of attributes and values, where each link in the chain defines more precisely who you are. Which attributes are necessary or useful depends on what you will use the certificate for, and which Certificate Authority you use. This page lets you specify the most useful attributes. If you leave a field blank, that attribute will be omitted from your name.

Although most browsers will accept 8 bit ISO 8859-1 characters in these fields, it can't be counted on. To be on the safe side, use only US-ASCII.
Your two-letter country code, for example GB (United Kingdom). This attribute is required.
The state where you are operating. VeriSign requires this attribute to be present for US and Canadian customers. Do not abbreviate.
The city or locality where you are registered. VeriSign requires that at least one of the locality and the state attributes are present. Do not abbreviate.
The organization name under which you are registered with some national or regional authority.
This attribute is optional, and there are no specific requirements on the value of this attribute.

This is the DNS name of your server (i.e. the host part of the URL).

Browsers will compare the URL they are connecting to with the Common Name in the server's certificate, and warn the user if they don't match.

Some Certificate Authorities allow wild cards in the Common Name. This means that you can have a certificate for *.roxen.com which will match all servers at Roxen.Thawte allows wild card certificates, while VeriSign does not.
For how long should the certificate be valid?
A certificate includes a validity period. How many days, from now, do you want the certificate to be valid?
Save the request in a file:
Generate a new RSA key pair...
Note that it is possible to have more than one certificate for the same key.
Generate a Certificate Signing Request and an RSA key...

An X.509 certificate associates a Common Name with a public key. Some certificate authorities support "extended certificates", defined in PKCS#10. An extended certificate may contain other useful information associated with the name and the key. This information is signed by the CA, together with the X.509 certificate.
An email address to be embedded in the certificate.
At last, you can add attributes to the Certificate Signing Request, which are meant for the Certificate Authority and are not included in the issued Certificate.
This password could be used if you ever want to revoke your certificate. Of course, this depends on the policy of your Certificate Authority.
This is your Certificate Signing Request.
Generate an RSA key and a Self Signed Certificate...
Generate an DSA key and a Self Signed Certificate...
